paper_metadata.title: The study analyzed the impact of the Productive Safety Net Program (PSNP) on Household Asset Building (HAB) in drought-prone areas of Southern Ethiopia

program_information.target_population: Smallholder farmers and pastoralists in drought-prone areas

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: Over the last three decades, at least 10 to 12 million people in Ethiopia have received food aid or participated in food/cash-for-work programs within the framework of PSNP Ethiopia

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: The study's findings indicate that the PSNP has positively influenced the asset holdings and consumption patterns of beneficiary households compared to non-beneficiary households
study_characteristics.study_design: Cross-sectional survey with Propensity Score Matching (PSM)
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: Cross-sectional survey data were collected from 180 randomly sampled households, including both PSNP beneficiaries and nonbeneficiaries. The analysis included both inferential and descriptive methods, utilizing a Propensity Score Matching (PSM) technique

bonus_information.cost_mentions: annual budget of nearly 500 million USD
bonus_information.cost_evidence_citation: Initiated in 2005, the PSNP, with an annual budget of nearly 500 million USD, reaches more than 7 to 12 million people in Ethiopia

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: The study analyzed the impact of the Productive Safety Net Program (PSNP) on Household Asset Building (HAB) in drought-prone areas of Southern Ethiopia
evidence_citations.country_citation: The study analyzed the impact of the Productive Safety Net Program (PSNP) on Household Asset Building (HAB) in drought-prone areas of Southern Ethiopia
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: Persistent shocks leading to the depletion of household assets pose ongoing challenges for the livelihoods of smallholder farmers and pastoralists in Ethiopia
